intro: Nephrodium crinitum var. glaucescens, commonly known as the glaucous nephroid, is a variant of the nephroid plant characterized by its distinctive glaucous-blue foliage. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is a fern-like plant with intricate, divided fronds. The leaves are typically bi- or tri-pinnate, with a delicate, feathery appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its unique coloration and structure make it a notable species in botanical gardens and horticultural collections.
